class_notes: Ireland of the Welcomes. Ireland of the saints and scholars. Ireland of the Celtic Tiger. Ireland of the Troubles. Which Ireland do we imagine is the real Ireland? As novelist Anne Enright puts it, "Ireland is a series of stories it tells itself. None of them are true." We will read a wide range of Irish authors including Oscar Wilde, W.B. Yeats, Lady Gregory, Eavan Boland, Brian Friel, and Seamus Heaney. There will be a particular focus on the Irish historical and political contexts relevant to these writers, and on the ways in which the imagined Ireland intersects with the `real' Ireland. Expect frequent writing posts, a midterm quiz, presentations, and a final project.
course_description: An interdisciplinary course which examines the trajectory of Irish writing from the 1890s to the present.
